#182

To Sultan Mustafa III,Pharoh of the Upper and Lower Nile,Defender of the Holy Cities of Mecca and Medina,King of Damascus,King of Mespotamia, Emperor of all Turks, of the Ottoman Dynasty

Her Imperial Majesty will only agree to a five year pact of non-agression if the additional lands in the map below are added We will also pay an extra economic point. In order to sign the ten year pact of non-agression you must remove your claims to Algeria. As a sign of friendship, we will extend the pact of non-agression to fifteen years as well as send an extra economic point in two years in addition to the two that will be sent next year.

Signed and Sealed, Her Imperial Majesty Czarina Catherine II the Great of the House of Romanov,

Heiress to Rome, Mother of Her Country, Guardian of the Holy Orthodox Faith, and Empress of All the Russiasâ€‹

OOC: Sorry that I got this whole name thing started. Well, at least mine is shorter than the others. I mean seriously, the Austrian one is freaking long. Sheep should really put most of it in a spoiler.

To: Her Imperial Majesty Czarina Catherine II the Great of the House of Romanov,

Heiress to Rome, Mother of Her Country, Guardian of the Holy Orthodox Faith, and Empress of All the Russias

We agree to these terms and the releaseing of Algeria.Also to the 2 points now and 1 later.We hope that our two Empires can come to further terms of alliance in the future.

Signed,

Sultan Mustafa III,Caliph of Islam,Pharoh of the Upper and Lower Nile,Defender of the Holy Cities of Mecca and Medina,King of Damascus,King of Mespotamia, Emperor of all Turks, of the Ottoman Dynasty

Got to love Imperial Royal families and their titles

It's THERESA! Stop writing "Thresca"!

#189

Here's a little family tree detailing the relationship between the two "Maria Antonias" (the daughter of Maria Theresa listed as "Marie Antoinette" to avoid confusion).

Now a brief history:

Emperor Leopold I's first two wives provided him with no surviving male heirs, but with his third wife he was blessed with two: Joseph (the elder) and Charles. At Leopold's death in 1701, Joseph became Emperor Joseph I. His marriage produced no surviving sons, so at his death in 1711 his younger brother became Emperor Charles VI. He, too, had no sons, so he issued the Pragmatic Sanction of 1713, which provided for his posessions to be inherited by his eldest daughter, Maria Theresa; the title of Emperor would go to her husband, Francis Duke of Lorraine. Most European monarchs agreed to this, and the issue seemed settled. At his death in 1740, however, many countries contested the succession, and the War of Austrian Succession began. The office of Emperor was taken by Charles Elector of Bavaria, Joseph I's son-in-law, becoming Charles VII. Maria Theresa's Austrian forces would defeat him and take Bavaria, and after his death his son Maximilian would make peace with the Habusburgs, agreeing to support Francis Duke of Lorraine in exchange for the return of Bavaria.

Both Maria Theresa and Charles VII, enemies in war, would name a daughter Maria Antonia. They were second cousins.

I hope that wasn't too complicated.
